alert.note: Alert for Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 5:15PM EDT until July 07 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL RUTLAND AND CENTRAL WINDSOR COUNTIES... At 515 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.0 and 4.0 inches of rain have fallen. Up to an additional inch of rainfall is possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Woodstock, Bridgewater, Barnard, Stockbridge, Killington, Plymouth, Pomfret, Bethel, Royalton, Mendon, Shrewsbury, Mount Holly, Bridgewater Center, Bridgewater Corners, Silver Lake State Park, South Sherburne, West Bridgewater, Gaysville, Rood State Park and South Pomfret. A large mudslide is affecting Route 4, which is closed, near Killington. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
